00012 /*

00017 #include "hw_init.h"
00018 #include "hw_uart0.h"
00019 #include "includes.h"
00020 
00021 /*
00022 *********************************************************************************************************
00023 *                                             CONSTANTS
00024 *********************************************************************************************************
00025 */
00026 #define RxBufferSize   8                         /* Alway should be a power of 2, so we shift in HW. */
00027 
00028 /*
00029 *********************************************************************************************************
00030 *                                             FILE LEVEL GLOBALS
00031 *********************************************************************************************************
00032 */
00033 static INT8U RxHeadPtr = 0; 
00034 static INT8U RxTailPtr = 0; 
00035 static char RxBuffer[RxBufferSize];  /* circular buffer for incoming pointers */ 
00036 
00037 /*$PAGE*/
00038 /*
00039 *********************************************************************************************************
00040 *                                        InitMSP430UART0
00041 *
00042 * Description: This function initializes the uart0 on the MSP430 board.
00043 *
00044 * Arguments  : none
00045 *
00046 * Returns    : none
00047 *
00048 * Note(s)    : 
00049 *********************************************************************************************************
00050 */
00051 void InitMSP430UART0()
00052 {
00053     RxHeadPtr = RxTailPtr = 0;
00054     U0CTL  |= UART_LFO_CRTL;     
00055     U0TCTL |= UART_LFO_TX_CRTL;  
00056     U0BR0 = UART_LFO_B0_CRTL;    
00057     U0BR1 = UART_LFO_B1_CRTL;    
00058     U0MCTL = UART_LFO_M_CRTL;    
00059     ME1 |= (UTXE0|URXE0);        
00060     UCTL0 &= ~SWRST;               // Do  a software reset of the serial port.
00061     IE1 |= (URXIE0 | UTXIE0);      // Enable UART0 interrupts 
00062 }
00063 
00064 /*$PAGE*/
00065 /*
00066 *********************************************************************************************************
00067 *                                        UART0RXIntHandler
00068 *
00069 * Description: This function is called by the uart0 Rx handler. This function job is to save the incoming 
00070 *              byte locally and send a notifiction upto the kernel that there is byte received. 
00071 *  
00072 * Arguments  : none
00073 *
00074 * Returns    : none
00075 *
00076 * Note(s)    : 
00077 *********************************************************************************************************
00078 */
00079 void UART0RXIntHandler( void )
00080 {
00081    char recvdByte = U0RXBUF;
00082    if ( ((RxHeadPtr + 1) % RxBufferSize) != RxTailPtr) /* If the queue is not full */
00083    {
00084         RxBuffer[RxHeadPtr] = recvdByte;
00085         RxHeadPtr = (RxHeadPtr + 1) % RxBufferSize;
00086         OSSerialByteRxRecvd();                             /* Notify the Upper layer about a new byte */
00087    }
00088 }
00089 
00090 /*$PAGE*/
00091 /*
00092 *********************************************************************************************************
00093 *                                        UART0TXIntHandler
00094 *
00095 * Description: This function is called by the uart0 Tx handler. This function only job is to 
00096 *              report character transmission to the kernel. 
00097 *
00098 * Arguments  : none
00099 *
00100 * Returns    : none
00101 *
00102 * Note(s)    : 
00103 *********************************************************************************************************
00104 */
00105 void UART0TXIntHandler( void )
00106 {
00107         OSSerialByteTxSent();   /* Acknowlege the kernel about last byte sent */
00108 }
00109 
00110 /*$PAGE*/
00111 /*
00112 *********************************************************************************************************
00113 *                                        UART0SendByte
00114 *
00115 * Description: This function is part of the HAL (hardware abstration layer). This function needs to be
00116 *              defined as specified by the HAL design. This function abstract actual hardware byte 
00117 *              transmission from the application and BSP level software.
00118 *
00119 * Arguments  : Data -- byte that is supposed to be written out.
00120 *
00121 * Returns    : none
00122 *
00123 * Note(s)    : 
00124 *********************************************************************************************************
00125 */
00126 void UART0SendByte(const char Data)
00127 {
00128         U0TXBUF = Data; /* Write the byte to the hardware, it is safe. */
00129 }
00130 
00131 /*$PAGE*/
00132 /*
00133 *********************************************************************************************************
00134 *                                        UART0GetByte
00135 *
00136 * Description: This function is called by the upper layer to reterive an received byte. 
00137 *              This function is part of the HAL (hardware abstration layer). This function needs to be
00138 *              defined as specified by the HAL design. 
00139 *
00140 * Arguments  : none
00141 *
00142 * Returns    : char
00143 *
00144 * Note(s)    : 
00145 *********************************************************************************************************
00146 */
00147 char UART0GetByte()
00148 {
00149         char byteReturn = 0; 
00150 
00151    if (RxTailPtr != RxHeadPtr) /* This should never happen since the kernel wait for receive before calling this */
00152         {
00153                 byteReturn = RxBuffer[RxTailPtr];
00154                 RxTailPtr = (RxTailPtr + 1) % RxBufferSize;
00155         }
00156 
00157         return byteReturn;
00158 }
